questions.question_text: Which of the following Android libraries are used to render 2D (SGL) or 3D (OpenGL/ES) graphics content to the screen?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A. OpenGL/ES and SGL.
OpenGL/ES (Embedded Systems) is a library used for rendering 2D and 3D graphics in Android, while SGL (Scala Graphics Library) is a lightweight alternative for 2D graphics rendering. Both libraries are used to render graphics content to the screen.
Here's a brief explanation of the other options:
B. Surface Manager: Manages the display surfaces and coordinates the rendering of graphics buffers, but doesn't render graphics content itself.
C. Media framework: Handles audio and video playback, recording, and streaming, but not graphics rendering.
D. WebKit: A web browser engine used for rendering web pages, not graphics content.
A > cross-platform API for rendering advanced 2D and 3D graphics on embedded and mobile systems

The correct answer is D. myisamchk.
myisamchk is a MySQL utility used to check, repair, and optimize MyISAM tables, as well as perform recovery operations on MyISAM log files. It can be used to fix corrupted tables, rebuild indexes, and recover data from a crashed MyISAM table.
Here's a brief explanation of the other options:
A. mysqldump: A utility used to dump the contents of a MySQL database into a file, but not for recovering MyISAM log files.
B. myisamaccess: Not a valid MySQL utility.
C. myisamlog: Not a valid MySQL utility (although myisamchk can work with MyISAM log files).

Selected Answer: C
To process the MyISAM log file and perform recovery operation, display version information, etc.,

questions.question_text:
You are assigned a task to examine the log files pertaining to MyISAM storage engine. While examining, you are asked to perform a recovery operation on a
MyISAM log file. Which among the following MySQL Utilities allow you to do so?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D (net start) is the right answer... not be confused with netstat!

questions.question_text: Andie, a network administrator, suspects unusual network services running on a windows system. Which of the following commands should he use to verify unusual network services started on a Windows system?

discussion.content:
So, correcting last statement:
Prior Vista the “y” denotes sequential number starting from 0, not one.
On Vista and later, the “y” denotes the sequential number starting from one, not 0.

Selected Answer: A
Prior Vista the sequential number started from one.
In Windows Vista and later versions the sequential number starts from 0.
[ selecting A ] cause its says "old windows" but answer can be option B as well cause Vista now days is an old windows version too. 
https://info-savvy.com/understand-anti-forensics-techniques/

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
However there is a mistake in the CHFI V10 book. 
In page 429 the example is wrong. Is is written that: "De7.doc is the eighth file". It is false it is the 7th. 
However the text in page 431 is correct. It is written that "Dxy.ext the "y" denotes the sequential number starting from one". 
I have resintalled an XP machine to check and I confirm that the sequence starts at 1.

Selected Answer: A
Shouldn't 5 mean it's the 6th document deleted (as it starts counting at zero)?

comments.content: Actually, in the context of Windows Recycle Bin file naming conventions, the number does not start at zero. The number represents the sequential order of deletion starting from one. So, 5 indeed means it is the fifth document deleted from the C: drive

No, per EC council material: "For example, in the case of a Dxy.ext file in the Recycled folder, “x” denotes the name of drive such as “C,” “D,” and others; “y” denotes the sequential number starting from one; "

choices.B: A text file deleted from C drive in fifth sequential order
choices.D: A text file copied from C drive to D drive in fifth sequential order
choices.A: A text file deleted from C drive in sixth sequential order
choices.C: A text file copied from D drive to C drive in fifth sequential order

questions.question_text: Randy has extracted data from an old version of a Windows-based system and discovered info file Dc5.txt in the system recycle bin. What does the file name denote?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A. ff d8 ff.
The hex code "ff d8 ff" is the signature header for JPEG image files. Most image file formats have a unique header or signature that can be used to identify them. By searching for this specific hex code, Sheila can potentially identify hidden JPEG image files on the hard disk.
Note: Other image file formats have different headers, such as GIF (47 49 46 38), PNG (89 50 4e 47), and BMP (42 4d 38 36). but these are not in the answers

questions.question_text: Sheila is a forensics trainee and is searching for hidden image files on a hard disk. She used a forensic investigation tool to view the media in hexadecimal code for simplifying the search process. Which of the following hex codes should she look for to identify image files?
